description: From Latin cohaesus, past participle of cohaereō, +‎ -ive.

adjectives.description: cohesive (comparative more cohesive, superlative most cohesive)

examples: The thesaurus (Chapman, 1977) lists two pages of mechanical tools, two pages of joining functions, and a half page of adhesives, binders, and cohesives used to build or repair consumer goods.

entries.meaning: (linguistics) A device used to establish cohesion within a text
examples: The fourth of this group of cohesives is the anaphoric, same UT.
